In sports science, what does the term 'VO2 max' refer to?
A. The maximum amount of oxygen a person can utilize during intense exercise
B. The maximum heart rate of an individual
C. The maximum speed at which an athlete can run
D. The maximum amount of weight an athlete can lift

The term 'VO2 max' in sports science refers to the maximum amount of oxygen that an individual can utilize during intense or maximal exercise. It is a measure of the efficiency with which the body uses oxygen and is often used as an indicator of cardiovascular fitness and aerobic endurance. So, the correct answer is A. The maximum amount of oxygen a person can utilize during intense exercise.
